intro: Mycetia anlongensis var. multiciliata, commonly known as the hairy mycetia, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Caesalpiniaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves with multiple small, hairy stipules. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in racemose inflorescences. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in moist, shaded environments. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest in both horticulture and ecological studies.
